Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The VIDEOINFOHEADER structure describes the bitmap and color information for a video image.

member.name: VIDEOINFOHEADER.rcSource
member.summary: A structure that specifies the source video window. This structure can be a clipping rectangle, to select a portion of the source video stream.

member.name: VIDEOINFOHEADER.rcTarget
member.summary: A structure that specifies the destination video window.

member.name: VIDEOINFOHEADER.dwBitRate
member.summary: Approximate data rate of the video stream, in bits per second.

member.name: VIDEOINFOHEADER.dwBitErrorRate
member.summary: Data error rate, in bit errors per second.

member.name: VIDEOINFOHEADER.AvgTimePerFrame
member.summary: The desired average display time of the video frames, in 100-nanosecond units. The actual time per frame may be longer. See Remarks.
